intro: Myosotis incana, commonly known as the hairy forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Myosotis incana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
